Data suggest gene expression in vascular endothelium is altered by dietary factors; aged garlic extract induces expression of HMOX1 (heme oxygenase-1) and GCLM via activation of NRF2-ARE (nuclear factor erythroid 2-antioxidant response element) signaling.

ES2 cells are more resistant to carboplatin than OVCAR3 and the abrogation of GSH production by BSO sensitizes ES2 to carboplatin. name: glutamate-cysteine ligase modifier subunit
other_names: glutamate-cysteine ligase modifier subunit delta2 alternative splicing

kegg.name: Cysteine and methionine metabolism - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Metabolic disorders of biological oxidation enzymes

wikipathways.name: Phytochemical activity on NRF2 transcriptional activation

summary: Glutamate-cysteine ligase, also known as gamma-glutamylcysteine synthetase, is the first rate limiting enzyme of glutathione synthesis. The enzyme consists of two subunits, a heavy catalytic subunit and a light regulatory subunit. Gamma glutamylcysteine synthetase deficiency has been implicated in some forms of hemolytic anemia. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2015].
